pr_title: Ignore the thread waiting time in the calculation of TPM-C.

timeline.bodyText:
Can this happen? We can start a new txn even after the provided time has passed?
What is considered as txn start time? We should include keying time in that. For example, suppose that:

We start tpcc run at time 0.
At time 299, we start txn T1 and wait for keying time.
At time 310, we actually start the txn execution.
In this scenario, we should consider T1 because the keying time started in the specified time window (0-299).
timeline.author: ndeodhar

replies.bodyText: Discussed offline. This code makes sense since we want to calculate number of transactions processed (and not number of transactions generated).
replies.author: ndeodhar

timeline.bodyText: Let's log these on separate lines for better readability.
timeline.author: ndeodhar
ndeodhar
ndeodhar

timeline.message:
Ignore the thread waiting time in the calculation of TPM-C.

Summary:
For the calculation of TPM-C we used the entire duration of the run
which included the waiting time of the trailing transactions.

With this change, we ignore the transactions that complete after the
configured time and use the configured time for the calculation of
TPM-C.

Reviewers:
Neha
